greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) in binary is a run of 1-bits from the most significant 1-bit of n down to the least significant 1-bit of n, inclusive.
link: Kevin Ryde, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..8192
formula: a(n) = n + A334045(n) (filling in 0-bits, including n=0 by taking A334045(0)=0).
program: (Python) def a(n): return (1<<n.bit_length()) - (n&-n) if n else 0
results.author: _Kevin Ryde_, Jan 13 2021
